subtitle.text: The first birth control pill was FDA approved in the US, which led to all of todayâ€™s hormonal contraceptives.
The first Hormonal Implant (which led to Implanon and Nexplanon) was approved in 1990.
The first Hormonal IUD (starting with Mirena and followed by Skyla, Kyleena, and Liletta) was approved in 2001.
